explanation: struct UserEntry: needed to see the exact types/const-qualification of member pointers (in particular username and realm) and of the userhash/userdigest array types; assigning const char * parameters into non-const struct members is the primary potential MISRA violation. user_ids: needed to confirm its element type/qualifiers and that it is an array of struct UserEntry (confirms that entry points into mutable storage). user_ids_used: needed to confirm whether the index or storage is intended immutable/const (and to understand mutation of user_ids). MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (prototype): needed to check the parameter types for username/realm and output buffers (to determine whether passing const pointers to non-const parameters or writing through pointers might affect const-correctness). MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (prototype): same reason as above for the digest-calculation call. Together these symbols let an analyst determine whether pointers in this function (and assignments to struct fields) preserve const-qualification or drop it, which is required to check the MISRA rule.
